result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Gregory Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald Gregory Becker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald Gregory Becker was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Payment of court appointed attorney's fees to the Clerk of Courts, pay $200/month.
Complete a mental health evalution.
Compy with all conditions imposed by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Gregory Becker

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular

02:37 PM Defendant Ronald Gregory Becker in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Pribnow appears for DOC.  Unpaid court obligations - $342.00.  Will pay tomorrow, 8/30/19.  2:38 p.m.
from Probation/Parole Agent Michael Pribnow re: asking for probation to be extended, unable to reach Minnesota probation agent and/or Def.
Probation review hearing on August 29, 2019 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission form

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 3:31 Defendant Ronald Gregory Becker in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF65 heard at this time. Thorie: guilty to Ct#1 in 16CF29, dismiss Ct#2 and 16CF65. 3 years probation condition: AODA and mental health. Atty Petros and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 16CF29; Petros stipulates factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 in 16CF29. Dismisses Ct#2 in 16CF29 and 16CF65.  Petros addresses sentencing. Thorie calculates 4 days credit.  Court: S/W 3 years probation. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Payment of court appointed attorneys fees; pay $200/month towards the fees. Agent to consider an AODA and complete a mental health evaluation.  Court states 4 days jail credit.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on October 26, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Plea hearing on September 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 29, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant. 16CF29 has 2 counts. Judge reads Count 1 & Count 2, Atty Petros states no further ready.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing to both counts.  Not guilty plea received by the court. 16CF65 has 3 counts, Judge reads Count 1, Count 2, Count 3. Atty Petros states no further reading. Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing on all counts.   Not guilty plea received by the court. Pretrial Conference to be set.  The bond will continue as ordered. 11:26

11:20 Includes 16CF65 Defendant Ronald Gregory Becker in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant. Judge questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Received phone call this morning at 10:31 a.m. from Defendant's Mother Carol Becker indicating he has been admitted to Hennepin County Medical Center and will not be available on Wednesday for the scheduled preliminary hearing.  Told her she needs to contact Ronald's attorney, Christopher Petros and gave her phone numbers to contact him.
Christopher Petros
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Wm Thorie is present for the STate of WI  Defendant apprears without an attorney. The defendant wants an attorney. Court wants the PD to talk to him . The court explains about court appointed attorneys. Defendant will apply for court appointed if not approved for PD.
Preliminary hearing at 04-11-2016 10:30 am
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 4:52  Defendant Ronald Gregory Becker in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Ronald Gregory Becker in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant requests reading of the complaint   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Defendant will be hiring private counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
